      • JRepository

        public JRepository(java.io.File directory,
           java.lang.String name)
            throws NotDirectoryException
        Default constructor
        Parameters:
        directory - The directory in which the git repo works on. Should point towards existing
        name - The unique name of the git repo
        Throws:
        NotDirectoryException - If the given directory doesn't exist an exception wil be thrown

    • Method Detail

      • gitLoad

        public boolean gitLoad()
        This loads git into the given directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the local directory doesnt exist, an exception will be thrown.

      • gitInit

        public boolean gitInit()
        This initilizes the git repo object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the local directory doesnt exist, this exception will be thrown.

      • gitAdd

        public void gitAdd(java.io.File fileToAdd)
        This adds a file to the GIt repository
        Parameters:
        fileToAdd - The file to add to the git repo
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file doesn't exist, this exception gets thrown.
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.NoFilepatternException - If there is an error with the file, this exception will be thrown.

      • gitRm

        public void gitRm(java.io.File fileToRemove)
        This removes a file from the git repo
        Parameters:
        fileToRemove - The file to remove
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file or directory doesnt exist, this exception is thrown
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.NoFilepatternException - If there is an error with the file, this exception will be thrown.

      • gitCommit

        public void gitCommit(java.lang.String message)
        This commits all the files to the repo
        Parameters:
        message - The message for the commit.

      • gitPush

        public void gitPush()
        This pushes the changes to the git repo
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the directory of the git repo doesn't exist, this exception is thrown
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.JGitInternalException - If there is an error with pushing the changes, this exception is thrwn
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.InvalidRemoteException - If the the remote git repo doesn't exist or is down, this exception is thrown.

      • gitTrackMaster

        public void gitTrackMaster()
        This gets information about the master branch of the git repo
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the directory of the repo doesnt exist, this exception is thrown
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.JGitInternalException - If there is an error with the git repo, this exception is thrown
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.RefAlreadyExistsException - If the master branch already exist, this exception is thrown?
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.RefNotFoundException - If the remote git repo doesn't exist, this exception is thrown
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.InvalidRefNameException - If the name (i.e. Master) doesn't exist, this exception is thrown

      • gitPull

        public void gitPull()
        This pulls the latest version of the git repo from remote
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the directory of the local git doesnt exist, this exception is thrown
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.WrongRepositoryStateException - If the local branch is in a bad state, this exception is thrown
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.InvalidConfigurationException - If the local branch has a bad configuration, this exception is thrown
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.DetachedHeadException - If the master head is detached, this exception is thrown
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.InvalidRemoteException - IF the remote repo doesnt exist or is down this exception is thrown
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.CanceledException - If the pull is canceled by remote, this exception is thrown
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.RefNotFoundException - If the reference of the remote git repo not found, this exception is thrown
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.NoHeadException - If there is no head branch, this exceptin is thrown

      • containsRepo

        public boolean containsRepo()
        This determines if the local directory contains a git Repo
        Returns:
        True if it does, false otherwise

        public java.lang.String getName()
        This gets the name of the git repo
        Returns:

      • getDirectory

        public java.io.File getDirectory()
        This gets the directory of the local git repo
